SEARCH
Package tradedatacorp.smelter.lexical.binary

Class BinaryTools

java.lang.Object
tradedatacorp.smelter.lexical.binary.BinaryTools
public class BinaryTools extends Object
A utility class providing stateless static methods for converting between binary representations (arrays or collections) and integers.

  • Method Details

    • getMinimumNumberOfBits

      public static int getMinimumNumberOfBits(int nonNegativeInteger)
      Calculates the minimum number of bits required to represent a non-negative base-10 integer in binary.
      Parameters:
      nonNegativeInteger - a non-negative integer to be evaluated.
      Returns:
      The minimum number of bits to represent the non-negative integer. Example 1: getMinimumNumberOfBits(3); // returns 2. binary 11 => 3, minimum of 2 bits represents 3 Example 2: getMinimumNumberOfBits(5); // returns 3. binary 101 => 5, minimum of 3 bits represents 5

    • toUnsignedInt

      public static int toUnsignedInt(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a non-negative base-10 integer from an array of boolean values.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a non-negative base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element. Most significant bit is at index 0.
      Returns:
      The non-negative base-10 integer to be calculated. Example 1: toUnsignedInt(new boolean[]{true,true,true}); //returns 7. bool array represents 111 Example 2: toUnsignedInt(new boolean[]{true,true,false}); //returns 6. bool array represents 110

    • to2sCompInt

      public static int to2sCompInt(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a base-10 integer from an array of boolean values that represent 2s complement number.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a base-10 integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated. Example 1: to2sCompInt(new boolean[]{true,true,true}); //returns -1. bool array represents 111 Example 2: to2sCompInt(new boolean[]{false,true,true,true}); //returns 7. bool array represents 0111 Example 3: to2sCompInt(new boolean[]{true,true,false}); //returns -2. bool array represents 110

    • toUnsignedLong

      public static long toUnsignedLong(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a base-10 non-negative long integer from an array of boolean values that represent 2s complement binary number.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a non-negative long base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element. Most significant bit is at index 0.
      Returns:
      The base-10 long integer to be calculated. Example 1: toUnsignedLong(new boolean[]{true,true,true}); //returns 7L. bool array represents 111 Example 2: toUnsignedLong(new boolean[]{true,true,false}); //returns 6L. bool array represents 110

    • to2sCompLong

      public static long to2sCompLong(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a base-10 long integer from an array of boolean values that represent 2s complement binary number.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a base-10 integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated. Example 1: to2sCompLong(new boolean[]{true,true,true}); //returns -1L. bool array represents 111 Example 2: to2sCompLong(new boolean[]{false,true,true,true}); //returns 7L. bool array represents 0111 Example 3: to2sCompLong(new boolean[]{true,true,false}); //returns -2L. bool array represents 110

    • toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset

      public static int toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(boolean[] bin, int startIndex, int length)
      Calculates a base-10 integer from boolean array subset.
      Parameters:
      bin - A boolean array. Does not represent any particular type of format. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      startIndex - The index of the most significant bit in the subset to be used for the calculation.
      length - The total number of consecutive elements to be used in bin.
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated. Example: boolean exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true,false,true,false,true}; //10101 rep Example 1: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,1,3); //returns 2. subset array: 010, indexes 1, 2, and 3. Example 2: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,1,4); //returns 5. subset array: 0101, indexes 1, 2, 3, and 4. Example 3: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,0,4); //returns 10. subset array: 1010, indexes 0, 1, 2, and 3. Example 4: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,2,3); //returns 5. subset array: 101, indexes 2, 3, and 4

    • toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset

      public static long toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(boolean[] bin, int startIndex, int length)
      Calculates a base-10 long integer from boolean array subset.
      Parameters:
      bin - A boolean array. Does not represent any particular type of format. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      startIndex - The index of the most significant bit in the subset to be used for the calculation.
      length - The total number of consecutive elements to be used in bin..
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated. Example: boolean exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true,false,true,false,true}; //10101 rep Example 1: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,1,3); //returns 2L. subset array: 010, indexes 1, 2, and 3. Example 2: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,1,4); //returns 5L. subset array: 0101, indexes 1, 2, 3, and 4. Example 3: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,0,4); //returns 10L. subset array: 1010, indexes 0, 1, 2, and 3. Example 4: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray,2,3); //returns 5L. subset array: 101, indexes 2, 3, and 4

    • isEqualBoolArray

      public static boolean isEqualBoolArray(boolean[] bin1, boolean[] bin2)
      Determines if two boolean arrays are equivalent
      Parameters:
      bin1 - A boolean array.
      bin2 - A boolean array.
      Returns:
      true if both arrays have the same length and every element in bin1 is equal to the corresponding element in bin2; false otherwise. Example 1: isEqualBoolArray(new boolean[]{true,false},new boolean[]{true,false}); //returns true. Example 2: isEqualBoolArray(new boolean[]{true,false},new boolean[]{false,true}); //returns false. Example 3: isEqualBoolArray(new boolean[]{true,true},new boolean[]{true,true,true}); //returns false.
